title: Business Solution Specialist
description:
Do you want to be part of an exciting company offering great opportunities and a strong commitment to making a difference? We are currently looking for a Business Solution Specialist with a focus on M3 Production & Quality Management. Lantmännen’s Agriculture Sector drives competitive and sustainable farming with a broad range of production, from high quality seeds and animal feed to grain handling and analysis. With a strong focus on quality and traceability, we ensure every step meets the highest standards in our accredited laboratories. This is a key role in our ongoing Infor M3 cloud project - an excellent opportunity if want to get the chance to grow and contribute in a global group that takes responsibility, from field to fork.


**This is what you will do**

We are currently in an exciting journey of improvement since we are aiming to go live with Infor M3 Cloud Edition (CE) in the beginning of 2026. You will therefore directly be an active part in the M3 cloud-project and implementation phase.


As Business Solution Specialist (BSS) you will have the responsibility in our team to work with Infor M3 with production and quality management and manage integrations with our surrounding MES application as well as laboratory systems. You will join a team of experienced colleagues working with various parts of M3 Supply Chain and surrounding applications eager to support our daily operations with approximately 800 users spread across Sweden. We work in close cooperation with our businesses to develop stable, reliable and cost-effective IT solutions, which enhances our competitiveness and supports our business objectives.


After the Go Live and project closure in beginning of 2026, the team will maintain our cloud M3 solution and surrounding applications and stay informed about new features and perform testing when Infor releases updates. You will together with business stakeholders further develop efficiency in our new processes and tools where you will have a key function.


The position is located at our head office in Malmö, but for the right candidate the location is flexible. You will report to belong to the IT department at the Agriculture Sector.


  
**Skills & Requirements**
-------------------------


**This is what** **you need to succeed**


**You have:**


* An academic degree together with a few years’ experience from working with Infor M3 Food & Beverage.
* Experience in understanding and translating our Supply Chain process requirements.
* An ability to configure and maintain M3 supply chain modules within production, production maintenance (MOS module), warehouse management, quality management (QMS), distribution and purchase.
* A basic understanding of integrations and API:s from and to M3 (MeC) and partner systems.
* Know-how of Infor M3 Extensibility toolbox to improve our end-user experience.
* Experience of general output management and knowledge of Product Label Printing solutions is commendable.
* Strong communication skills, written and spoken, in both Swedish and English
**You are****:**

* A doer who enjoys taking initiatives and has a pragmatic approach to challenges.
* An enthusiastic team player, skilled at building strong relationships with internal stakeholders. You are skilled in adjusting your style and delivery to various audiences, always with a positive attitude.
* Analytical and solution-oriented, and can quickly grasps complexity and can take a holistic view whilst also having attention to detail.
* Reliable, you deliver consistently according to agreed goals and expectations.
You share our values - Openness, Holistic view, Drive - and our promise of taking responsibility from Field to Fork.  



  

**What we offer you**


We are a large international Group with diverse activities throughout the entire grain value chain –from the very sprout in the field to the food on our tables. With a wide range of businesses within food, agriculture, machinery, bioenergy and real estate, we offer career opportunities in every direction across industries, countries, companies and areas of expertise.  

  



**Sounds interesting?**


We hope so! You can apply for this position online, preferably as soon as possible, but no later than 5/12 2024. In your application, you will have the opportunity to include your CV or LinkedIn profile.


For a more objective and inclusive recruitment process, we do not request a personal letter. Instead, we ask you to answer selection questions relevant to the role. The recruitment process includes psychometric testing and competency-based interviews to ensure fair evaluation for all candidates. At Lantmännen, we believe in equal opportunities for employment and development within the group.


As a final candidate, a background check will be conducted through our provider ToFindOut. If you have questions about the position or the recruitment process, please feel free to contact Talent Acquisition Specialist Matilda Olbin at Matilda.Olbin@lantmannen.com.

  

We look forward to receiving your application!


  
**About the company**
---------------------


Lantmännen is an agricultural cooperative and Northern Europe’s leader in agriculture, machinery, bioenergy and food products. Owned by 18,000 Swedish farmers, we have 12,000 employees, operations in over 20 countries and an annual turnover of approximately SEK 70 billion. With grain at the heart of our operations, we refine arable land resources to make farming thrive. Some of our best-known food brands are AXA, Kungsörnen, Scan, GoGreen, FINN CRISP, Schulstad and Vaasan. Our company is founded on the knowledge and values acquired through generations of farmers. With research, development and operations throughout the value chain, together we take responsibility from field to fork. For more information: www.lantmannen.com.  



  

* creating results together


* international career opportunities from field to fork


* proud of our heritage, aiming for global growth


* focus on innovation and sustainability

title: Mechanical Engineer
description:
Microsoft’s Cloud Operations & Innovation (CO+I) is the engine that powers our cloud services. As a CO+I **Mechanical Engineer**, you will perform a key role in delivering the core infrastructure and foundational technologies for Microsoft's online services including Bing, Office 365, Xbox, OneDrive, and the Microsoft Azure platform.  

Our infrastructure is comprised of a large global portfolio of more than 200 datacenters in 32 countries and millions of servers. Our foundation is built upon and managed by a team of subject matter experts working to support services for more than 1 billion customers and 20 million businesses in over 90 countries worldwide.  

With environmental sustainability and optimization at the forefront of our datacenter design and operations, we continue to grow and evolve as we meet the ever-changing business demands that hold Microsoft as a world-class cloud provider.  

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.**Responsibilities**
--------------------

**Responsibilities**:* A strong desire and capability to learn, grow, and develop new skills
* Empower a culture of safety, security, and compliance in all aspect of data center activities
* Understand the design and functionality of your datacenter
* Work alongside a team of industry professionals across the Information Technology (IT) and Critical Environments (CE) spectrum to support 24x7x365 on-site datacenter operations and mechanical infrastructures.
* Act as the technical authority for on-site operations of large-scale mechanical systems and designs.
* Collaborate with the Operations and Design team to develop data center (DC) mechanical designs, starting from project conception to issue for construction (IFC) for new DC projects build outs and major infrastructure upgrades.
* Establish and coordinate maintenance & safety procedures, maintaining redundant high-capacity cooling systems; to operating and supporting datacenter backup electrical systems (diesel generators, rotary UPS, etc.)
* Steward vital infrastructure supporting deployments of Microsoft's online services.
* Assist with supplier selection and overseeing mechanical supplier execution
* Learn, live, and coach the One Microsoft culture and values.? Lead through change by bringing clarity, generating energy, and delivering success

**Qualifications**
------------------

**Required Qualifications:** **Microsoft reviews all applications that meet the below Qualifications:**  

For this role, you are welcome to apply if you meet the following **Required Qualifications**:* Very Strong technical engineering experience
* + OR Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Process Engineering or related field AND Good technical engineering experience
	+ OR Master's degree in Mechanical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Process Engineering or related field AND Good technical engineering experience

***While not required, we also look for the following Preferred Qualifications:**** Strong experience with the operation and maintenance of facility environments including heating and cooling systems. (AHU’s, Exhaust Fans, adiabatic, thermal storage systems, CRAC, fire suppression system, VESDA, security, life safety, and controls systems)
* Experience with alternative, energy efficient water treatment methodologies and developing chemistry programs for processed water treatment
* Understanding of maintenance & operation of critical environment backup equipment (Diesel generators, radiator, ventilation systems, fuel storage, distribution, & protection systems, etc.)
* Knowledge of construction techniques, terminology, and documentation (Your ability to interpret blueprints, electrical one-lines, construction drawings etc.)
* Practical experience with building management systems and automation, controls & frameworks

***Background Check Requirements:***
Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:* Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.

  


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

title: Supply Chain Optimization Specialist
description:

title: Test Engineer with focus on Automation
description:
**Let’s shape the future together**
-----------------------------------

  

We’re shaping our business around people. While our cars embrace leading-edge technologies, we never employ technology for its own sake. Quite the opposite. Instead, our focus is on adapting technology to benefit people. This philosophy extends to the sales and customer experience we aim to deliver. Do you want to be a part of creating the exciting solutions of tomorrow’s mobility? Then look no further, join us.

  


**Let's introduce ourselves**
-----------------------------



The Connected Experience organization within R&D includes Remote Functions, Connectivity and Car Cloud Platform, Infotainment Platform, Applications and Data & Diagnostics. Our vision and strategy are to maximize the attractiveness of owning and using a Volvo, make all cars connected and provide a continuously enhanced experience for both new and existing cars.

  

  

Our Agile Release Train (ART) Remote Functions mission is to enable remote functions globally to contribute to the overall connected experience. We build, provide, and operate a highly secure run-time ecosystem for functions and applications serving our connected cars, and their users. We aim to optimize functional and organic growth by using cutting edge standards from Car Connectivity Consortium® together with cloud serives, the latest technology from phone OEMs and connectivity. This new way of using your phone as the key for your car will opens up for a new connected experience. The journey into the future starts here.  



**What you'll do**
------------------



Are you a tech savvy tester in the automation domain with a long background in writing tests and planning test activities, a person who can see the big picture and dig into end-to-end testcases and who really enjoys adding quality on a solution level then read further and see the fantastic possibilities in this role. When we say testing we mean automation in our rigs, manual testing in the car and all in between.

  

  

As a Automation tester you will work close with our development teams including our current team of testers. You will be implementing and running tests of our embedded software with included in our CI. Our system is built on embedded software, hardware and wireless connecting to our cloud. And yes we will test on real mobile devices and cars as well. This role is a core competence in our future team build and you can expect a lot of fun in our journey towards the connected experience.  



**What you'll bring**
---------------------



We see that you have some background as automation tester both on hardware as well as software since this will be part of the tasks. Experience as developer and/or manual tester is preferred.  

We see that you have relevant education in test or development and at the same time really think that exploratory testing is an important way forward. Our field of development is very tech heavy but the test cases also need to be based in user experience.

  

  

**In particular we are looking for this in your skillset**  

* Test case execution
* Result documentation
* Test rig setup and testing
* Documented experience in automated testing and CI
* Programming knowledge for creating automated tests
* Python programming
* Pipeline experience
* Experience from automotive
* CAN bus experience
* Fault tracing and debugging experience
  

  

**Personal qualities**  

* Have a meticulous attitude
* Have sense of time and being goal oriented
* Good communication skills; the ability to share results verbally as well as in writing in a clear, concise manner to both technical specialists and people without technical knowledge
* Strong collaboration skills
* Structured and analytical way of taking on tasks and performing on a daily basis in a result oriented way

**Ready to Take the Next Step?**
---------------------------------

  

  

Please submit your application through our career page. Due to GDPR regulations, we’re unable to store or consider applications from other platforms. Make sure to submit your application in English.


If you have any questions about the recruitment process, you are welcome to reach out to Recruiter Malgorzata Dziczek at malgorzata.dziczek@volvocars.com For specific questions about the position, please reach out to Hiring Manager Cormac O'Brien at cormac.obrien@volvocars.com.

  

  

Once your application is successfully submitted, you’ll receive a confirmation email. Applications are open until 08th of December 2024. We’re excited to get to know you!

  



**Volvo Cars – driving change together**
-----------------------------------------

  

  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.


And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!

title: System Engineer
description:
**Imagine the mobility of tomorrow**
------------------------------------

  

  

Picture yourself in an exciting industry where the future revolves around leading-edge electrified and self-driving cars seamlessly integrated into people's daily lives. But how can we create this future in a way that is both safe and sustainable? This is just one of the inspiring questions we're working to solve here at Volvo Cars. Join us and watch your ideas shape the future of mobility.

  


**Let's introduce ourselves**
-----------------------------



Connected Experience is a unit within R&D. Our vision and strategy are to maximize the attractiveness of owning and using a Volvo, make all cars connected and provide a continuously enhanced experience for both new and existing cars. The agile release train "Remote Functions" is responsible for delivering the remote control aspects of our world class Volvo Cars app. The app we provide allows our customers to, for example, start climate, set charging timers or lock and unlock the doors, either from your phone, tablet or your watch.  



**What you'll do**
------------------



Your purpose as a System Designer, together with your colleagues in your agile team and the product owner, is to provide stepwise (business) value to the larger solutions/systems (via the Agile Release Train - ART). With main focus on system design, you will make sure that our customers get the best possible system with regards to functionality and quality of the Volvo Cars app. We also expect you to be on top of technology evolution and provide new ideas to continuously improve the product and our processes.


The product purpose is to give our customers remote access to the car from the comfort of their couch. Your focus is on system design and making sure our customers get the best possible system with regards to functionality and quality within the connectivity area. #LI-DNI


**What you'll bring**
---------------------



For you to fully enjoy this opportunity, we believe that you are a result-oriented individual with problem solving focus and good ability to adapt to constant changes. Business acumen, integrity and courage are characteristics that describes you very well. You are self-driven individual, someone who is positive and analytical. You need to be able to present the results in a structured and understandable way and take the ownership for the product.


You embrace teamwork, collaboration and are eager to learn and develop new competences. Experience from working in the automotive or telecom industry is a clear advantage to succeed in this role.


We see that you have a BSc degree or higher in Software- or/and Electrical Engineering, or equivalent experience. +5 years of system design, strong communication skills and EU driver license B.

  


In addition, you’ll need experience and competence in the following areas;  

* System design within large distributed systems
* Connectivity technologies 3G/LTE, WiFi, BLE, GNSS, Ethernet, CAN, USB
* Mobile App experience
* Experience with both in-car and cloud communication as well as different protocols used

Meritorious competence and experience:  

* Elektra
* SystemWeaver / CarWeaver
* Software development
* Testing
* CAN, Flexray, Ethernet SomeIP, Protobuf, ASN1 knowledge/experience

**Ready to Take the Next Step?**
---------------------------------

  

  

Please submit your application through our career page. Due to GDPR regulations, we’re unable to store or consider applications from other platforms. Make sure to submit your application in English.

  

  

**Volvo Cars – driving change together**

  

  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.  

  

And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!


Curious about Life at Volvo Cars? Read more


Curious about our story? Read more

title: Business Transformation Manager
description:
**Xensam: SAM Disrupters**  

Xensam is the leading provider of AI-powered, cloud-hosted Software Asset Management technology. We’re looking for key players to join us as we scale our impact and build the Xensam team together. We take our culture seriously and strive to maintain the excellence, energy & enthusiasm that flows through the organization today.


We look for candidates who are passionate about what they do and ready to work the Xensam way. We know that experience counts, but we also know that it’s you, the person behind the experience, that makes it count.

**About the role**  

We are seeking a dynamic and strategic Business Transformation Manager to lead the integration of internal systems and processes across our organization. This pivotal role acts as the bridge between Research & Development (R&D) and the Business organization, ensuring seamless communication and collaboration.


The ideal candidate will identify integration opportunities, streamline workflows, and foster a culture of innovation and efficiency to drive business outcomes.


**Responsibilities**

**Systems integration and optimization**

* Analyze internal systems to identify integration opportunities that enhance efficiency, scalability, and performance.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement solutions aligned with organizational goals.
* Lead initiatives to streamline workflows and optimize the use of tools and technologies.

**Communication Management**

* Act as the main liaison between Business and R&D, ensuring clear communication and alignment.
* Translate business needs into actionable R&D requirements and vice versa.
* Manage communication protocols to ensure timely updates on priorities and deliverables.

**Project & Change Management**

* Lead cross-functional projects to improve internal processes, ensuring delivery within scope, budget, and timeline.
* Drive change management initiatives to integrate new practices and tools.
* Monitor project impact and adjust strategies to meet objectives.

**Strategic Collaboration**

* Partner with leadership to identify growth opportunities through improved system integration.
* Align R&D and Business teams on product development, go-to-market strategies, and customer success.
* Identify and address bottlenecks, fostering collaboration across departments.

**Reporting & Insights**

* Develop and maintain dashboards to track integration progress and impact.
* Provide regular updates to leadership on key metrics and areas for improvement.

**Qualifications**

* **Minimum of 5 years** experience in a similar role.
* Strong knowledge of internal systems and processes, with a proven record of successful integration and optimization.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to mediate, influence, and resolve conflicts.
* Expertise in project management, proficient in tools like Jira, Asana, or similar platforms.
* Analytical mindset with the ability to identify and address operational inefficiencies.
* Familiarity with product development cycles and sales processes is a plus.

**What you get**

* A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
* Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
* Free access to beverages, snacks, gym facilities, on-site massage, shuffleboard, and other games.
* If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
* Join an ambitious and diverse team, and work with cutting-edge technology in the fastest-growing SAM software on the market.
* An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.


At Xensam, our core values define our culture:

**Rebellious**: We encourage a spirit of freedom and initiative within responsibility.

**Humane**: We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.

**Harmonious**: We promote work-life balance, creating a pleasant, supportive workplace.



Join Xensam for a balanced, collaborative, and growth-focused work environment. If you're a team player ready to thrive, **APPLY now!**

title: Management Consultant - Graduate to Capgemini Invent Malmö
description:
***Do you want to jumpstart your career and get real hands-on experience of developing new digital solutions and business models of the future?***

**Capgemini Invent is looking for** **inventive and driven graduates** **to join our team in** **Malmö** **. As a** **Consultant** **at Capgemini Invent, you will advise global business leaders and clients in significant digital transformation projects, together in a team.** ***You will belong to one of our sub teams within Enterprise Transformation; Business Technology, Workforce & Organization or Data & Analytics.***

**What can you expect?**

* **Working in a diverse environment and collaborating with our market-leading clients and experienced consultants, within Sweden-Denmark-Finland – and globally.**
* **Joining a fast-growing firm on its continuing transformation journey and becoming part of a consulting powerhouse.**
* **Experience rapid learning, a well-defined career path, and support to develop into a successful consultant. In addition, you will benefit from training and mentoring programs to support your development.**
* **Capgemini Invent stands out with our collaborative culture and people, skilled professionals, industry expertise and comprehensive end-to-end capabilities within our Group.**
* **Embrace a culture where employees shape their own future. Enjoy a welcoming, social workplace with many exciting events and activities.**

**The person we wish to invite to join our mission:**

* **Holds a Master’s degree, with strong academic records, within e.g.,** **Business, Engineering,** **Data, Computer Science, or Technology.**
* **Graduates during 2025 with excellent results.**
* **Demonstrates exceptional analytical problem-solving skills, a creative mindset, and a passion for genuine innovation.**
* **Possesses an entrepreneurial drive for creating change and an insatiable thirst for learning.**
* **Excels in collaborative efforts and is comfortable working independently.**
* **Quickly grasps client business matters and is passionate about future trends.**
* **Holds excellent communication skills in Swedish and English.**
* **In addition, international and professional experiences as well as extracurricular activities are seen as meriting.**

**We welcome to join in** **Fall 2025, and you will be located in our office in Malmö,** **but with readiness to travel and work on projects at our client sites.**

**Does this sound like a great opportunity, are you ready to get the future you want?**

**Seats are filled on an ongoing basis; we encourage you to apply as soon as possible!** **Apply by sending your** **CV and application in English and official University transcripts and High School grades. Please state clearly** **in your application your** **expected graduation date** **.** ***Please note that only complete applications are considered.***

**About Capgemini Invent** **and the Group**

**As the digital innovation, design and transformation brand of the Capgemini Group, Capgemini Invent enables CxOs to envision and shape the future of their businesses. Located in over 30 studios and more than 60 offices around the world, it comprises a 12,500+ strong team of strategists, data scientists, product and experience designers, brand experts and technologists who develop new digital services, products, experiences and business models for sustainable growth.**

**Capgemini Invent is an integral part of Capgemini, a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.**

**We are very much looking forward to hearing from you!**

**Read more about us at:** **https://www.capgemini.com/se-en/service/invent/**  

**Here you can find what our fantastic employees say about us:** **https://www.capgemini.com/se-en/careers/career-at-invent/**

***#LI-DNI***

title: DevSecOps Engineer
description:
SwediumGlobal is seeking for experienced DevSecOps Engineer

If you feel excited about grabbing this onsite career opportunity, we are happy to hear from you!

Location :Gothenburg, Sweden

Job Description :DevSecOps Engineer

Role:

We are currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced DevSecOps Engineer. While prior experience with Microsoft Azure services is a plus, we value a solid foundation in cloud infrastructure maintenance, integration setup, and a good understanding of IT service management processes.

Your commitment to delivering exceptional support to our internal products will be crucial in this role with the below,

Key Responsibilities:

· Manage incident and problem resolution related to Azure SQL Database.

· Engage in effective communication with customers while addressing specific incidents.

· Collaborate with other support teams, including third-party vendors, when necessary, to escalate and resolve incidents.

· Keep customers informed about monitored performance issues in Azure SQL Database.

· Handle Azure SQL Database access management.

· Act on behalf of the application team to manage tasks such as,

o Migrations,

o Version Upgrades,

o Resource requirements,

o Cost Assessments & SLAs

· Assess disaster recovery strategies and solutions as needed.

· Monitoring & troubleshooting issues in Kubernetes/OpenShift clusters.

· Stay up-to-date with Azure security tools and best practices.

· Participate in incident response and security incident investigations.

· Provide support during the standard 9-to-5 CET working hours, acknowledging the potential expansion to 24/7 support and/or on call support beginning in 2025.

​​

Required Qualification:

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Security, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
* Good communication skills and stakeholder management experience.
* Experience in Container orchestration platforms like Kubernetes and OpenShift.
* Proficiency in creating operational and design documentation for the solutions you develop/build artefacts, along with the ability to write post-incident reports after addressing/troubleshooting service-related issues.
* Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools, such as Ansible and Terraform.
* Competence in working with Azure-hosted databases and virtual machines.
* Experience in utilizing Azure monitoring and logging tools.
* Knowledge of high-availability Azure services.
* Understanding of Networking and Cloud Infrastructure within the Azure environment.
* Familiarity with Azure backup solutions.
* Capability to propose/follow security best practices.
* Experience working with Splunk as a monitoring tool is a plus.
* Experience with security testing tools and vulnerability assessment is a plus.

​

Employment Type :Permanent

Contact Us: rajesh.lakshmanan@swediumglobal.com or deepthi.meka@swediumglobal.com

Job Type: Full-time

Work Location: In person

Expected Start Date: 06-01-2025

title: QA Engineer
description:
**Rebtel is looking for a QA Engineer**


* Do you want to strive for and celebrate success with ambitious people from all over the world?
* Are you looking for that rare place that is a combination of start-up spirit and stable business growth?


**The role**



You will be part of the Rebtel team - a small team, achieving big things. You will support and contribute to our testing strategy for the Frontend applications that are used by millions of our users.


***Key Responsibilities***


*Develop, execute, and maintain* ***manual and automated test cases*** *for frontend applications for both Web and Mobile**Conduct* ***functional, regression, and performance testing*** *for our* ***Web and Mobile application****.**Collaborate with cross-functional teams (developers, product managers, designers) to define test plans, test scenarios, and acceptance criteria.**Identify, document, and track bugs using tools like* ***JIRA****.**Ensure test coverage by writing* ***end-to-end tests*** *using frameworks as* ***Cypress, and/or Appium (Webdriver IO)****.**Participate in* ***code reviews*** *to identify potential issues early in the development process.**Analyze and report on* ***test results****, providing insights to improve product quality and user experience.**Support* ***continuous integration*** *and* ***continuous deployment (CI/CD)*** *processes by integrating automated tests into the pipeline.*


**Requirements**


* Minimum of 4 years of experience in automation testing
* A genuine passion for software quality and testing
* Strong knowledge and experience with automation testing frameworks like: **Cypress**, **Postman**, **WebdriverIO**, and **Appium**
* Experience with **JavaScript** / **Typescript**
* Familiarity with CI/CD tools like **Jenkins**, **GitLab CI**, or **GitHub Actions**.
* Proficient in using bug tracking tools (e.g., JIRA, Trello).
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail.
* Excellent communication skills in English and the ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.


**Bonus points**


* Experience with monitoring tools
* Experience with performance testing tools
* Knowledge of cloud providers, specifically Azure and AWS
* Experience with GraphQL and/or REST


*We are Rebtel - People from all around the world, as of now 27, countries and more to come. We believe in equal opportunity and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.*
company_description: Our team mirrors our global audience: we are a diverse team of people from over 30 different countries that get together everyday.

title: Lead Engineer - Energy Products & Grid
description:
Innovation starts with being curious.  

At Volvo Cars, we believe that being curious and truly committed to understanding people is the key to future success. We are people who care about other people, working together to create new technologies and innovations.

  


Want to join us?  



**Let's introduce ourselves**
-----------------------------



In 2020, Volvo Cars released its first fully electric vehicle, the XC40 Recharge, with ambitions to electrify its entire line-up by 2030. Electrification of the vehicles and the entire energy eco-system around them is at the core of Volvo Cars strategy and a highly prioritized area within our company. While this transition is in line with our core value of sustainability, we recognize electric vehicles are only part of the equation when it comes to sustainable mobility. As such, we wish to offer our customers a convenient way to optimize the flow of energy in their homes, thereby reducing their carbon footprint and electricity bills.

  


Within the Energy Products & Grid team, we are responsible for developing competitive solutions outside of the vehicle, ranging from wallboxes and energy storage solutions to Vehicle to Grid (V2G) design and testing.

  


We are part of the Energy Management organization within Engineering, working closely together with areas like EV Charging, HV Battery, App and Cloud teams. Together we are delivering AC- and DC-charging functionalities as well as energy management systems internal and external the vehicles. Technologies like V2X, Smart charging and Wireless charging are just around the corner!

  


The external energy systems area is growing and will play a more important role for Volvo Cars in the future. Our ambition is that Volvo Cars’ customers shall have the opportunity to charge their vehicles in a sustainable and safe way, and the possibility to integrate with smart energy management systems. Part of this is to develop the best software & hardware quality and functionality in the market and to continuously evolve our way of doing this. This is where we want your help!

  


**What you'll do**
------------------



As a Lead Engineer you will lead the development of our products external the vehicle. This includes leading our interaction with suppliers as well as acting as the main interface both internal and external the team, related to the product(s). You have the overall responsibility for the product technical logical plan, cost and quality, with support from software and hardware expertise inside our team.

  


We see that you strengthen our existing team with experience from leading industrial development projects including both hardware and software content. Close collaboration between different teams and suppliers is vital in this role, so good communication skills, flexibility and openness are key. You need to have a high personal drive and sense of ownership, as this technology area is new and partly immature.

  


**What you'll bring**
---------------------


* BSc/MSc in Electrical Engineering, Energy Systems, Power Systems or a related field
* Experience in software and hardware product development
* Experience from an OEM within home energy systems, such as EV charging/energy management/solar power/energy storage, is highly meritorious
* Knowledge of Charging solutions, both public and private, is meritorious
* Prior experience with project management
* An innovative mindset
* Fluent in English (written and spoken)
* Driver’s license (B)

  




**Who are you?**
----------------



 You are passionate about energy solutions and cars, both from customer and technical point of view. You have a high level of engagement and a strong enthusiasm. It is crucial to be good at cross-functional work and networking, since collaboration with internal and external stakeholders will be part of your daily work, hence you need to possess great communication and collaboration skills. You need to be structured and have organizational skills, to guide the development in the desired direction.

  



Ready to Take the Next Step?  

We welcome you to apply in English by 06th of December the latest. Please apply through career site due to GDPR reasons. Applications submitted via email will not be taken into consideration.

  


  

Volvo Cars – driving change together  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.

  


And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: Data Analyst
description:
**Work with us towards a greener future**
-----------------------------------------

  

  

Climate change is a reality. As a mobility provider, we recognise our impact on the environment and are determined to play our part in contributing to sustainable solutions. And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. If you share our commitment for creating a positive environmental impact, then join us in our mission to advance towards a greener future.

  


**About Us**
------------



TheEngineering Data Hub drives transformation and implementation of data, analytics & AI within Volvo Cars Engineering. The department handles competence growth and collaborations within data, analytics & AI. The department is cross-functional, consisting of data engineers, data scientists, machine learning engineers and software engineers developing product applications and services with both direct and indirect connection to our cars. By analyzing large amounts of vehicle data with customer centric analytics & AI, we enhance our products with new and improved functions and services.

  

We are now looking for a senior machine learning (ML) engineer that can complement our team in building automated solutions for extracting insights and building new functions for our vehicles and services. We seek a person with experience in building efficient and robust AI systems from early concept ideas to production ready code and applications. You are technically skilled and can drive projects forward by leading the technical development hands on, and by effective collaboration and knowledge sharing with others.


**Required Qualitfications**
----------------------------


* MSc in statistics, machine learning, computer science, applied mathematics or other related field. Or proven experience achieved by other means.
* 3+ years of experience as a machine learning engineer (or equivalent).
* Strong programming skills and in-depth knowledge of machine learning frameworks (e.g. PyTorch, Tensorflow and scikit-learn).
* Strong hands-on experience with developing scalable cloud solutions for ETL, training and deployment pipelines for ML models demanding large amounts of data.
* Experience in MLOps practices covering the whole machine learning lifecycle.
* Strong communication skills.

  

**Meritorious**
---------------


* Experience of verification and validation of ML algorithms and functional safety.
* Strong industrial experience from automotive is regarded as an advantage.
* Experience in analytics and modelling of time series data.
* Edge computing for distributed analytics and AI.

  

**What we offer**
-----------------


* Dynamic work environment within a team of computer scientists, mathematicians, statisticians and physicists
* Full support for continuous personal development at all levels with our own “Volvo Cars School of Data Science” program
* Lots of data to play with and a wide range of application domains

**Ready to Take the Next Step?**
---------------------------------

  

  

Please submit your application through our career page. Due to GDPR regulations, we’re unable to store or consider applications from other platforms. Make sure to submit your application in English.


If you have any questions about the recruitment process, you are welcome to reach out to Recruiter Gabriela Moraes at gabriela.moraes@volvocars.com.

  

  

Once your application is successfully submitted, you’ll receive a confirmation email. Applications are open until 2nd November 2024. We’re excited to get to know you!

  



**Volvo Cars – driving change together**
-----------------------------------------

  

  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.


And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: Emerging Enterprise Account Executive, Nordics
description:
SLSQ425R934



Databricks operates at the leading edge of the Data Analytics space with a mission to help companies solve the world's toughest problems.



Reporting to the Sales Director for Emerging Enterprise, you will be supported by a team of accomplished big data, AI and industry specialists. Your mission will be to promote the use of Databricks across a select group of small/ medium businesses and mid-market accounts operating in the Nordics. You will be offered huge potential for career progression with the pace of the team's growth.



As an Account Executive at Databricks, you love understanding a product in depth and are passionate about communicating its value to customers and partners. Always prospecting for new opportunities, you will close new accounts while upselling existing accounts. Along with the chance to close exciting deals, we also offer accelerators above 100% quota accomplishment.


**The impact you will have:**

* Assess your territory and develop a successful account execution strategy
* Exceed activity and revenue targets
* Track all customer details including use case, purchase time frames, next steps, and forecasting in Salesforce
* Identify new use case opportunities and showcase value to prospects
* Promote the value of the Databricks' Data Intelligence Platform
* Ensure 100% satisfaction among all customers


**What we look for:**


* Experience penetrating new accounts, executing on first use cases, growing initial consumption and closing deals in a direct sales role
* Experience in relevant software sales development role with consumption sales motion
* Some exposure to software industry and grasp of basic concepts of selling SAAS, Big Data and Business Value
* Basic understanding of the data platform and cloud ecosystems
* Experience exceeding sales targets / quotas
* Success closing new accounts while working on existing accounts
* Passion for cloud technologies
* Bachelor's Degree or relevant work experience
* English is required, Swedish is a plus

**About Databricks**



Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.  

  

**Benefits**  

  

At Databricks, we strive to provide comprehensive benefits and perks that meet the needs of all of our employees. For specific details on the benefits offered in your region, please visit https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks.

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**



At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.


**Compliance**



If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.
company_description: Databricks, the data and AI company, helps data teams solve the world’s toughest problems.

title: Gruppchef
description:
**Vi söker en gruppchef som vill vara med och bygga bolag**


Vi är ett bolag med drivna ägare som vill utmana branschen och tillföra mer kundnytta genom rådgivning och digitalisering inom redovisning och administration. Cloud Redovisning & Administration startade 2018 och är en fullservicebyrå som hjälper kunder med löpande bokföring, bokslut, årsredovisning, lön, deklarationer samt rådgivning.

 **Om arbetet**


Som gruppchef på Cloud Redovisning & Administration ingår du i bolagets ledningsgrupp och innehar det direkta budget och resultatansvaret för din grupp. En viktig del i arbetet är att planera och fördela arbetet så en jämn arbetsbelastning uppnås och ett effektivt arbetssätt upprätthålls. Vi ser med tillförsikt på framtiden så du kommer även att vara involverad i rekrytering av nya medarbetare tillsammans med vår rekryterare. Du blir också ett viktigt stöd för dina kollegor i deras fortsatta karriärutveckling. Därför är det viktigt för oss att du är en lagspelare som blir motiverad av att se andra växa och utvecklas.


Du kommer även att ha en hel del kontakt med kunder samt ansvara för att ge stöd och rådgivning till deras medarbetare och chefer. Vi vill att du aktivt deltar i att utveckla våra interna processer samt våra kunders arbete med ekonomi och redovisning. Tillsammans skapar vi en bra tjänst för våra kunder där du och dina kollegor kan erbjuda den bästa servicen.

 **Vem är du?**


Vi önskar att du har stor erfarenhet av redovisning, bokslutsarbete, deklarationer och av att bygga relationer med olika kunder. Vi är en modern redovisningsbyrå som hela tiden utvecklas och därför är det viktigt att även du blir motiverad av det. Vi brinner för utveckling och digitalisering och tror därför att du också känner dig motiverad av att vara en del av ett sådant sammanhang. Du blir motiverad av att se andra personer utvecklas och tar ett genuint ansvar för det genom att lyssna aktivt på dina medarbetare.

 **Vi erbjuder**


På Cloud Redovisning & Administration finns en plats för dig som vill bredda din kompetens och arbeta på ett företag som värnar om balansen mellan arbete och privatliv. Du kommer att ha stora möjligheter att påverka din egen utveckling men också att ha stor insyn i företaget där kan du påverka och fira framgångar med oss.


Ta kontakt med oss så tittar vi på vad som är viktigt för just dig.

 **Vi söker dig som:**

* gillar att umgås med människor och ta ansvar
* är serviceinriktad och vill arbeta i en omväxlande roll
* har stor erfarenhet av bokslutsarbete.

  

Frågor kring tjänsten ställer du till Per Lindström på tel: 070 281 81 85


Ansökan till tjänsten mailar du på per.lindstrom@cloudredovisning.se

title: IFS solution consultant
description:
**Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.**  

  

**YOUR ROLE**  

**We are seeking an IFS Application Consultant to join our fast-growing team.**  

  

**Capgemini has made a strategic decision to grow our IFS capacity in the Nordics. We do this in close collaboration with IFS and with a unique partnership. Our goal is to be the Nr 1 IFS Partner in Europe.**

**As a Solution Consultant, you will map customers’ business processes to business systems/applications, answer their queries, resolve issues, and offer advice in improving their solutions.**

**You will continuously develop yourself by acquiring new knowledge within the Capgemini targeted customer segments, in relevant or new IFS related functionality. You will share your knowledge with both customers and colleagues.**

**What we offer**

**In this role, you get a variety of work tasks and the possibility to gain knowledge in several areas. You will build a broad competence that is highly valued in many other teams - the career opportunities are many. You will be part of a highly engaged team who collaborates to solve complex support issues, you always get help from your teammates! Further developing your skills, you can access IFS Academy and get certified within your chosen areas.**

  

**YOUR PROFILE**  

**We are looking for people with a passion for technology, business processes and customer experiences. You also need to be able to communicate and collaborate with other people at various levels.**  



***To be successful in this role you need:***

* **Drive and a wish to learn new things**
* **Attention to details**
* **Excellent communication and cooperation skills**
* **Good ability to analyze and solve issues**
* **Deliver good service with the highest quality**
* **“Can do” attitude**

  

***Your skills:***

* **Degree, preferably or relevant professional qualifications**
* **Minimum of 3 years of experience in IFS Applications or similar business applications**
* **Solution-oriented mindset, with a passion for technology, business processes and customer support.**
* **Interest in interacting with customers and helping them find solutions as well as suggesting enhancements to improve their processes.**
* **Curiosity and eagerness to learn, a proactive approach and ability to adapt quickly to new processes and procedures.**
* **Fluency in Swedish and English, written and spoken.**
* **Knowledge of PL/SQL/REST will be an added advantage.**

**About Capgemini**

**Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world while creating a tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market-leading capabilities in AI, cloud, and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion. Get The Future You Want |** **www.capgemini.com**
company_description: Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology.

title: Senior Technical Specialist- Industry Data Platform (m/f/d)
description:
You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.
Senior Technical Specialist- Industry Data Platform
Are you a seasoned technician with a passion for system administration, development, and application management? Are you excited by the challenge of working in a mixed environment with diverse tasks and responsibilities? If so, we want you to be part of our innovative team!
At Industry Data Platform, we're searching for a Senior Technical Specialist who is not only technically proficient but also embodies the values of humility, flexibility, and service-mindedness. Our ideal candidate thrives in dynamic settings and brings a creative problem-solving attitude to the table.
Key Responsibilities* Manage and optimize Linux clusters
* Utilize FTP, NFS, and various communication protocols for seamless operations
* Troubleshoot complex issues across multiple applications
* Maintain systems for monitoring and observability
* Administer Windows servers
* Implement and manage network load balancing


Required Experience* Several years of expertise in:
	+ Bash Scripting
	+ MySQL/MariaDB and Maxscale clusters


Beneficial Skills* Knowledge of HA Proxy
* Experience with Docker Swarm
* Proficiency in PHP
* Familiarity with Kubernetes
* Understanding of Zabbix


Why Join Us?* Impactful Work: Engage in troubleshooting customer-specific issues and contribute to significant projects like application migrations, container scaling, and cluster optimization for databases and production servers.
* Cutting-Edge Environment: Work primarily with Linux and Windows servers. Be part of our strategic shift towards cloud integration to enhance efficiency and scalability.
* Collaborative Culture: Join a team dedicated to developing and maintaining a robust technical environment that powers document production and processing for hundreds of clients.
* Opportunities for Growth: Contribute to high-impact projects and leverage new technologies to drive business goals.


About Us
Our team at Tietoevry Industry is focused on optimizing and maintaining our platforms to efficiently process data from a multitude of clients. Our environment is multifaceted, with a primary application on Quadient (GMC) Inspire alongside numerous proprietary services.  

  

Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust, and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
Apply Now!
Embark on a rewarding career with us where your contributions will make a tangible impact. If you're ready to take on diverse challenges and grow your skills in an innovative environment, apply today! Don't miss this opportunity to become a key player in our exciting journey towards the cloud.
If you have any questions, please feel free to reach out to hiring manager Kristin Hauge, at kristin.hauge@tietoevry.com, or Lead Talent Acquisition Rojin Amini, at rojin.amini@tietoevry.com.
Looking forward to having you on the Tietoevry team!*We perform background checks on all final candidates.*  

*Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.*
At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Data Warehouse Technical Owner to ICA Banken
description:
Are you a proactive technical expert passionate about optimizing and maintaining critical data infrastructure? ICA Banken is looking for a Data Warehouse Technical Owner to take charge of our comprehensive MS SQL-based Data Warehouse, ensuring optimal performance, security, and seamless data integration. Join our dynamic Data Management team and drive innovations that connect data across systems for future-ready analytics.

 **About the role as DW Technical Owner**


As our DW Technical Owner, you will be the driving force behind the stability and efficiency of our MS Windows-based Data Warehouse environment. Your role encompasses:

* Maintaining and optimizing MS SQL databases, ensuring they are secure, compliant, and performant.
* Overseeing day-to-day operations, tackling incidents swiftly, and handling problem resolution.
* Coordinating the change management process.
* Facilitating smooth integration with internal and external systems.
* Supporting developers in resolving technical challenges and reviewing SQL code.
* Collaborating on strategic transformations, such as integrating with the ICA Google Cloud Platform to enable efficient data movement.
  

You will be interacting with several stakeholders and teams within ICA and be crucial in our transition towards a more interconnected, compliant, and efficient data ecosystem.

  

  

**We are looking for y****ou**


You bring extensive experience with MS SQL Server (versions 2016 or later) and related applications, like SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, and Visual Studio. You are skilled in:

* Managing SQL Agent Jobs, optimizing indexes, and improving stored procedures.
* Troubleshooting, performing data transfers, and refining table structures for performance.
* Familiarity with tools like Splunk, Red Gate, Kafka, Grafana, and Tableau is a plus.
  

You have relevant formal education or equivalent experience, and applicable Microsoft certifications and training. Strong English proficiency is essential, and experience in Data Warehouse design and the Banking & Insurance sector is beneficial. This role can be located at ICA Banken’s HQ in Borås or at the office in Solna.

  

If you are ready to elevate our data capabilities and make a significant impact, ICA Banken is the place for you!

 **Apply now**


Any kind of questions about the position contact hiring manager Johan Karlsson, Manager Data Analytics +4610 422 02 28, questions about the selection process or terms & conditions at ICA please contact recruiter Klara Himmelstrand, +4672 050 78 44. Apply as soon as possible, but no later than 2024-12-09.

 **About ICA Banken**


We are an everyday bank that lasts longer. We create personal, simple and affordable services for the ICA customer. Every day. Our business concept is to make everyday life a little easier for ICA's customers through financial services, as well as increase customers’ loyalty to ICA and reduce the ICA stores' and ICA AB's transaction costs for foreign banks and credit cards.


We are supposed to mirror our customers as well as the society and require employees with different competences. We strive at recruiting people with different backgrounds and value knowledge and experience that brings in. We value good conditions for a sustainable work life by have a good working environment and possibilities to constant evolution. If roles require it, you will need to undergo tests, background checks and drug testing before employment.

title: Data Community Manager – Stockholm
description:
Are you passionate about fostering a culture of data literacy and empowering others through data-driven insights? Do you enjoy building and nurturing communities, and thrive in bringing people together to advance the use of data for impactful decision-making? If so, we want you to join our team as a Data Community Manager within the AI, Analytics & Data tech center.
  
In this key role, you’ll take the lead in developing and growing a vibrant data analytics community across the organization, while creating and implementing engaging training programs tailored to both technical and non-technical audiences. By collaborating with cross-functional teams, subject matter experts, and external partners, you’ll play a crucial part in helping our company build data fluency and accelerate our journey toward becoming a fully data-driven organization.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:****Training and Program Development:**  

– Collaborate closely with platform teams, data governance experts, business partners, and vendors to design and deliver effective onboarding content for the data analytics community.
  
– Create and update training programs, in partnership with subject matter experts, that help data analysts seamlessly transition to our next-gen platform and stay informed on new features and best practices.
  
– Lead decision-making forums with relevant stakeholders to establish best practices and ensure clear communication of these decisions to the community.
  
– Drive initiatives that help move the organization closer to its goal of being data-driven, such as educational workshops, events, and internal training programs.
  
  

**Building and Nurturing the Data Community:**  

– Cultivate a strong, engaged data analytics community by promoting knowledge sharing, collaboration, and continuous learning.
  
– Develop and maintain relationships with subject matter experts to contribute insights and materials for training, demos, case studies, and community events.
  
– Organize and facilitate community activities such as hackathons, webinars, workshops, and meetups to encourage collaboration and engagement around data-driven initiatives.
  
  

**Promoting Data Literacy:**  

– Champion the importance of data literacy throughout the organization and advocate for its integration into all aspects of business decision-making.
  
– Develop impactful, easy-to-understand content in various formats (newsletters, presentations, videos, infographics, internal communications) to drive awareness and engagement within the data community.
  
  

**Measuring Impact and Success:**  

– Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess the success of community engagement and training effectiveness.
  
– Regularly evaluate progress, provide insights, and recommend improvements to optimize community initiatives and training programs.
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

– A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field.
  
– At least 5 years of experience in community or program management, or a data-related role with a focus on data-driven initiatives.
  
– Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to create content that resonates with both technical and non-technical audiences.
  
– A strategic mindset with strong attention to detail, ensuring that all initiatives align with the larger organizational goals.
  
– Proven ability to collaborate with diverse teams and stakeholders to drive decisions and execute programs.
  
– Experience organizing and executing successful community-building events, both virtual and in-person.
  
– A strong understanding of current technology trends, with an emphasis on data analytics and AI.
  
– Data-driven, with the ability to analyze both quantitative and qualitative metrics to draw meaningful insights.
  
– Highly organized with strong project management skills to handle multiple initiatives simultaneously.
  
  

**Bonus Points:**  

– Experience leading or growing AI and data communities.
  
– A background in data analytics or AI, with proficiency in tools such as Python, R, SQL, and Google Cloud Platform.
  
If you’re eager to make an impact by fostering a data-centric culture and helping others harness the power of data to drive innovation, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Bussines Analyst /Data Community Manager – Stockholm
description:

title: Business Transformation Manager
description:
**Xensam:** SAM DisruptersXensam is the leading provider of AI-powered, cloud-hosted Software Asset Management technology. We’re looking for key players to join us as we scale our impact and build the Xensam team together. We take our culture seriously and strive to maintain the excellence, energy & enthusiasm that flows through the organization today.
  
We look for candidates who are passionate about what they do and ready to work the Xensam way. We know that experience counts, but we also know that it’s you, the person behind the experience, that makes it count.
  
About the roleWe are seeking a dynamic and strategic Business Transformation Manager to lead the integration of internal systems and processes across our organization. This pivotal role acts as the bridge between Research & Development (R&D) and the Business organization, ensuring seamless communication and collaboration.
  
The ideal candidate will identify integration opportunities, streamline workflows, and foster a culture of innovation and efficiency to drive business outcomes.
  
Responsibilities
  
Systems integration and optimization
  
Analyze internal systems to identify integration opportunities that enhance efficiency, scalability, and performance.
  
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement solutions aligned with organizational goals.
  
Lead initiatives to streamline workflows and optimize the use of tools and technologies.
  
  

Communication Management
  
Act as the main liaison between Business and R&D, ensuring clear communication and alignment.
  
Translate business needs into actionable R&D requirements and vice versa.
  
Manage communication protocols to ensure timely updates on priorities and deliverables.
  
  

Project & Change Management
  
Lead cross-functional projects to improve internal processes, ensuring delivery within scope, budget, and timeline.
  
Drive change management initiatives to integrate new practices and tools.
  
Monitor project impact and adjust strategies to meet objectives.
  
  

Strategic Collaboration
  
Partner with leadership to identify growth opportunities through improved system integration.
  
Align R&D and Business teams on product development, go-to-market strategies, and customer success.
  
Identify and address bottlenecks, fostering collaboration across departments.
  
  

Reporting & Insights
  
Develop and maintain dashboards to track integration progress and impact.
  
Provide regular updates to leadership on key metrics and areas for improvement.
  
  

Qualifications
  
Minimum of 5 years experience in a similar role.
  
Strong knowledge of internal systems and processes, with a proven record of successful integration and optimization.
  
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to mediate, influence, and resolve conflicts.
  
Expertise in project management, proficient in tools like Jira, Asana, or similar platforms.
  
Analytical mindset with the ability to identify and address operational inefficiencies.
  
Familiarity with product development cycles and sales processes is a plus.
  
  

What you get
  
A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
  
Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
  
Free access to beverages, snacks, gym facilities, on-site massage, shuffleboard, and other games.
  
If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
  
Join an ambitious and diverse team, and work with cutting-edge technology in the fastest-growing SAM software on the market.
  
An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.
  
  

**At Xensam, our core values define our culture:**  

**Rebellious:** We encourage a spirit of freedom and initiative within responsibility.
  
**Humane:** We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.
  
**Harmonious:** We promote work-life balance, creating a pleasant, supportive workplace.
  
  

Join Xensam for a balanced, collaborative, and growth-focused work environment. If you're a team player ready to thrive, APPLY now!

**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?**  


Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls, or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than **400 million** active users per month.
* Founded in 2009 with an impressive year-on-year growthwithhigh profitability, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, Large Cap.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv **with high ambitions**.


**We, at the Data Science and Analytics Products team,** build centralized data products that serve the business and our customers. We collaborate across all of Truecaller, delivering products that require centralized ownership or where the competence to build the products is not present in the wider product organization.
**As a Senior MLOps Engineer,** you will lead the transformation of our MLOps platform and will be responsible for reimagining and rebuilding it to enable fast, scalable, and cost-effective machine learning model development and deployment. You will also help set the best ways of working to make the best use of the platform and increase developer productivity. This role is critical to our mission of accelerating model training, deployment, and experimentation. Your work will directly impact our ability to deploy models within hours, support automated machine learning (AutoML), and enable teams across the organization to experiment with and deploy generative AI models.
**The impact you will create:**
* Lead the MLOps transformation in Truecaller by designing and building the infrastructure needed to enable our teams.
* Understand the current and future needs of developers and the organization, and create a roadmap with your manager for meeting those needs.
* Collaborate closely and support developers throughout the organization to make model training, development, and monitoring fast, scalable, and cost-efficient.
* Stay up to date with the latest trends and technologies in MLOps, AI, and cloud computing, and drive continuous innovation throughout Truecaller.


**What you bring in:**
* 5+ years of experience building and maintaining tools and platforms for feature engineering, model training, model deployment, model monitoring, and A/B testing model performance.
* Strong programming skills in Python and shell scripting.
* A strong understanding of CI/CD pipelines and automation tools.
* Expertise in infrastructure as code (for example, Terraform).
* Strong understanding of machine learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, ONNX).
* Strong experience in cloud platforms (we use GCP) and cloud-native tools.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively across different teams and disciplines.
* A customer-focused mindset.


**It would be great if you also have:**
* Experience with AutoML tools (for example H2O.ai or Auto-Keras).
* Experience enabling generative AI experimentation, fine-tuning, and deployment.
* Experience with Go.


**It would be great if you also have:**
* Experience with AutoML tools (for example H2O.ai or Auto-Keras).
* Experience enabling generative AI experimentation, fine-tuning, and deployment.

We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.

**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.**

We only accept applications **in English**.
**What we offer:**
* **A smart, talented, and agile team:** An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* **A great compensation package:** Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* **Great tech tools:** Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
* **Office life:** We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There is something for everyone!

Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. **All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you**

**About Glean**  



We’re on a mission to make knowledge work faster and more humane. We believe that AI will fundamentally transform how people work. In the future, everyone will work in tandem with expert AI assistants who find knowledge, create and synthesize information, and execute work. These assistants will free people up to focus on the higher-level, creative aspects of their work.
We’re building a system of intelligence for every company in the world. On the surface, you can think of it as Google + ChatGPT for the enterprise. Under the hood, our platform is the connective tissue between AI and knowledge. It brings all of a company’s knowledge together, understands it at a deep level, provides industry-leading search relevance over it, and connects it to generative AI agents and applications.  


Glean was founded by a seasoned team of former Google search and Facebook engineers who saw a need in the enterprise space for their technical depth and passion for AI. We’re a diverse team of curious and creative people who want to help each other get big things done—so we can help other teams do the same.
We're backed by some of the Valley's leading venture capitalists—including Sequoia, Kleiner Perkins, Lightspeed, and General Catalyst—and have assembled a world-class team with senior leadership experience at Google, Slack, Facebook, Dropbox, Rubrik, Uber, Intercom, Pinterest, Palantir, and others.

5-6 years of closing experience in direct Sales with a track record of being a top performer
